channel.title: Projects on Gregor von Laszewski
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Gregor von Laszewski

item.title: Cloudmesh Pi Burn
item.description: cm-burn github: https://github.com/cloudmesh-community/cm-burn cm-burn is a program to burn many SD cards for the preparation of building clusters with Raspberry Pi’s. The program is developed in Python and is portable on Linux, Windows, and OSX. It allows users to create readily bootable SD cards that have the network configured, contain a public ssh key from your machine that you used to configure the cards. The unique feature is that you can burn multiple cards in a row.

item.title: Cloudmesh
item.description: Cloudmesh enables you to access multi-cloud environments such as AWS, Azure, Google, and OpenStack Cloudsvery easily. To start a vm on AWS you can say cms set cloud=AWS cms vm boot To start one on Azure, simply set the cloud accordingly cms set cloud=AWS cms vm boot Cloudmesh is an evolution of our previous tool that has been used by hundreds of students and cloud practitioners to interact easily with clouds to create a service mashup to access common cloud services across a number of cloud providers.
